column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$1$4$I have been on a combination of 300 mg Wellbutrin and 150 mg of Effexor for 10 years. I have finally weaned myself off of the Wellbutrin gradually as it caused trouble sleeping which then required that I take 2mg of clonazepam. My dreams were so vivid and weird. I would be running and running all the time and wake up exhausted. I'd dream about people I hadn't seen in 20 years who I barely knew. Wild weird dreams and extrememly vivid. I have been able to cut my clonezapam down to 1mg and hope to gradually wean myself off of that as well. I hate taking a narcotic to offset the effects of the Wellbutrin. It did pull me out of a severe depression which was the lowest point of my life but I hope to make it without it. I waited until after the seasonal fall depression was over before beginning my withdrawal of the drug. I had attempted to quit smoking and my doctor gave me a stop smoking medication. The combination made me feel suicidal. Do not take Wellbutrin in addtion to Chantix.....!!!! ever ever. My depresson started when I was peri-menopausal

column7: as before I started using this medication

column10: but now it's because I have a reason for it
column11: like people with normal brain chemistry. You're supposed to have mild depressed feelings when bad things happen
column12: and so I've learned to distinguish between these feelings and the depression I lived with most of my life. I have more energy
column13: am more motivated

column16: as I believe my life could have been so different. I wouldn't stop taking Bupropion at this point even if they tried to tell me that I didn't need it anymore. I expect to take it for the rest of my life

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$4$"I went to a psychiatrist complaining of an inability to pay attention to tasks for long periods of time and feeling very sorry for myself after some set backs in my career.  The more he asked me questions
column3: the more I finally realized that I was depressed and had been for a couple of years. I was having such negative dark thoughts and the doctor prescribed this to me with a high dosage immediately.  It took a few weeks but I am so glad I got help.  I started to feel better
column4: had more energy where before I could barely make it through the day. I lost weight and started feeling more positive.  I experienced an increase in libido and a slightly decreased appetite.  I started exercising and although I've suffered some additional setbacks
column5: I have learned how to deal with them and keep moving forward.  I have forgotten to take my pills for 2-3 days at a time and I have began to feel ""icky"" again.  I am a work in progress and I hope that one day I will be able to live pill free by exercising regularly and eating a clean diet...I am working towards that but for now I am very happy with this medicine.  As for side effects
column6: I am lactose intolerant and have IBS so any nausea or other discomfort have been indistinguishable.  I have occasionally experienced dizziness and slight headaches but other than that
column7: I have not significant side effects.  "

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$4$"   Paxil was was not working and possibly making things worse. I wanted to get away from the SSRI/SNRI meds so I suggested Wellbutrin to my doctor as an alternative. He had some reservations but started me on the 75mg immediate release Bupropion. One tablet for two days. No problems so the dose was increased to two tablets per day for the next ten days. At this point I was feeling a bit ""wired"" with some muscle twitches and difficulty sleeping. I believe these are typical with this medication. Also had a slight headache. Not real bad but always there. At this point I am wondering if this is the right medication for me. Feeling ""different"" but not really getting the relief that I wanted. I went to three tablets per day for about three weeks. Still having some issues at this point but I was seeing some benefits. Went to four tablets for the next ten days with much improvement.

column1: My most recent prescription was for Bupropion HCL 100mg taken three times a day. After about six weeks into this I feel much improved and confident that this medication will work well for me. Do not discount the effectiveness of this medication too quickly as there are some rough spots to get past before any benefit is seen.

I did use low dose Klonopin to take the ""edge"" off the Bupropion. I did not need more than 1mg per day at the most and I am at a point where I believe I can stop it completely. The sleep issues have been resolved nicely with a 10mg dose of Doxepin at bedtime.
Each individual is different as to the medications that work best. This is working for me.

column1: 194$Depression$4/14/2011 2:54:00 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I started burpropion (generic version of Wellbutrin) almost a year ago after a tragic suicide left me with anxiety

column3: and PTSD. I was first prescribed Celexa which was great
column4: but I had gained weight. So a few months later
column5: my doc prescribed me Bupropion in addition. I was on 10mg/once a day Celexa and then prescribed 150mg/twice a day Bupropion. I had horrible side effects from the Bupropion- I felt drunk
column6: sea sick
column7: nervous
column8: loss of appetite
column9: couldn't sleep

column12: I have gotten a hold of my depression/anxiety/OCD/PTSD. And
column13: I have lost the 10 lbs I gained when first starting Celexa- yipee! If considering

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I took the name brand Wellbutrin SR 100 mg once a day for a week as prescribed for depression by my doctor.  After a week of this medication
column3: my doc wanted me to up the dosage to 2 pills daily. During my very first day of taking this medication I had adverse reactions.  My heart beat increased and I felt somewhat anxious.  Several days later I began taking the 2 pills per day as prescribed.  I noticed my neck began itching and had red blotchy spots appeared. Not only that but I became quite irritated and my husband said I was ""a bear"" while on this stuff. One of the most unpleasant effects was that I began ""clenching"" my teeth together and noticed an awareness in my teeth I'd never experienced before. This alarmed me so I called my dr's office. The nurse suggested I go back down to one pill again and come back in and see the doctor.  I have since been taking Sertraline (generic of Zoloft) with less adverse effects.  I have been on it now for almost 3 weeks and it's already much better than the Wellbutrin SR ever was.  The only good thing about this med is that it didn't have any bad sexual side effects...if anything it increased sexual desire.  But the bad far outweighed the good on this one."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$5$5$I need to point out that I was on Effexor XR for almost 10 years and was so eager to get off it. During inpatient at a psych ward

It did increase my anxiety and I had quite a few of the side effects. I stuck through them and glad I did. I feel like such a weight is off my shoulders! My whole family/friends noticed a major difference in me. To all those complaining about side effects: every medication will have them. If you are truly eager to let a medication do it's job

column5: stick through it

521$Depression$8/2/2011 5:21:44 PM$Reviewer: bogey5, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$Just a little background. I suffered a severe neck injury( 3 surgeries) that rendered me disabled way before my time. Became depressed after I had to resign my job and give up golf and other activities that I loved. I tried several other meds but between the constant pain of my injury and the depression I could barely get out of bed. My Dr. put me on wellbutrin sr 100 mg twice daily at first and it helped for awhile before I fell back into a rut. Then he suggested 100 mg prestiq ALONG with the wellbutrin and everything just clicked. I know that this may be an strange combo but I also know that it has worked wonders for me ! I have proof every morning as my first hour of the day is still brutal until the medication takes hold. I now have the energy and resilience to face each day in a positive manor. A little wordy here but if I can help just one person it's worth the extra typing. I now have a renewed and much needed energy level and feel light years better than I had before.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$I have suffered from depression since 1994 and had been on a variety of SSRI's and TCA's before being tried on Wellbutrin SR 10 years ago. I found the SSRI's and TCA's all had similar side effects with me
column3: some lightening of the depression but I always seemed to have a crash when I was under stress that resulted in hospital admission for worsening depression and either suicidal thinking or an attempt. Initially my dose was titrated up to 300mg per day but I found I became very agitated and anxious at this dose and my doctor and I slowly decreased the dose to 150mg a day about 9 years ago which is the dose I have maintained. I found that I didn't have any crashes on Wellbutrin SR and I didn't feel depressed anymore. However I am a smoker and I never felt the urge to quit smoking or any reduction in my craving for cigarettes. This feeling of well-being continued until March of this year when a fill-in doctor prescribed 150mg a day of Wellbutrin XL instead of Wellbutrin SR.  Gradually over the last 3 months I have become more depressed and occasionally have suicidal thoughts. This surprised me when I started feeling this way again as there seemed to be no reason for it until I remembered that the doctor had changed my antidepressant from Wellbutrin SR to Wellbutrin XL. The drug manufacturer indicates that doses of the two drugs are equivalent and switching between them at the same dose should not result in any problems. However
column4: in my case
column5: I feel the dose of Wellbutrin XL would have to be increased to give me the same feeling of well-being that 150mg of Wellbutrin SR gave me. I will be switching back to Wellbutrin SR next week and expect that my feelings of depression will be history. As everyone responds to medication differently
column6: there is no reason to believe that anyone else will experience the same effects that I did. However
column7: it is something to consider if you are switched and find the same dose of Wellbutring XL to be not as effective as the Wellbutrin SR.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have suffered from depression and increasing anxiety for a very long time.  This is my first attempt with medication and I have had great results.  I have been on it for almost three months and I no longer cry everyday!  I am able to deal with my stress and I am able to confront issues that I am upset about instead of running away.  At first I had more panic attacks and had trouble with dizziness but that wore off after three weeks. Be careful driving for the first few weeks-I had problems with the dizziness and focusing about an hour after taking the pill. I also still have problems with my memory-forgetting important numbers and names.  I have noticed that I tend to feel anger and irritability if something is annoying me more so than without the drug.  I have lost 11 lbs so far and hope to continue with the weightloss.  I have had problems with insomnia but rememdy it with 1 Tylenol PM which helps tremendously. I quit smoking two years ago but now more than ever I can't stand the smell of cigarettes-hope I can get more accustomed to that soon.  This drug has improved my life so much-I am a completely new person and I am thankful that I decided to give it a try.

column14: eat more fiber and drink lots of water and if that is not enough ask your doctor if you can take a stool softener the first month or so you are on Wellbutrin. Your body should adjust after you have been on this for 3-6 weeks and then you should be able to taper off the stool softeners and be fine. PLEASE insist that your doctor tell you how to counter any side effects and try this for 6 wks before you decide whether it is for you. I know 4 people who have been greatly helped by Wellbutrin when no other antidepressants worked or when the other antidepressants had bad side effects.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$"Firstly note this medicine not for everyone. Everyone's brain chemestry is different. It is one of the most popular and commonly used antidepressant due to it's general efficiency and fewer shitty side effects than other drugs. Personally
column3: two weeks after starting 150mg bupropion
column4: I'm already starting to feel somewhat better overall.

column1: The way I've understood this drug works is by preventing the recapture of dopamine and noradrenaline. This leads to a slow but steady build up of those two chemicals in the brain. That' why the full efficiency of this drug is obtained a few weeks later after starting taking it. Dopamine is the feel good reward chemical which makes you feel slightly happier in general and makes you want to do things more since you're reward signal in the brain is ""boosted"". Not absolutely sur about the noradrenaline part but I think it's from this chemical adrenaline comes from. This could explain why this drug makes you more awake and energized than normally. Not sure but dopamine too i think helps keep awake. Anyways
column2: even the specialists aren't exactly sure HOW antidepressants exactly works.

column1: So far for me the first few days I felt a little ""something"" positively different about how I felt in general. I've been sadly having trouble to feel emotions and happyness for a very long time. Feel like a machine that mainly works eats and sleep. Now I'm starting to have more energy
column2: want to do more things and actually enjoy myself sometimes. Better mood. I actually smile because I feel like it sometimes instead of smiling because I'M supposed to. Don't oversleep anymore. More sociable. Better attention and focus. Think better. Got some libido back. Losing fat and gaining muscle since im more active. Seems I'm actually starting to enjoy life a little. So far the pros are better than cons. Insomnia (i need seroquel to sleep well)
column3: rise in anxiety are the two downsides. A bit worst in the begining but it lessens. Got used to it. Definately worth it for me."

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$3$"I have been taking this drug for a few weeks and it seems to have reduced my depressive moods and thoughts.  I was severely depressed
column3: hardly left the house because of low energy
column4: lack of focus
column5: and stress.  I had been through a job loss and marital problems that led to severe depression.  When I started the drug it gave me more energy and I felt more ""alive"".  I had a slight headache and a some insomnia at first but that got better after a few days.  I was somewhat short tempered at times but that is most likely the release of all the pent up frustration I had been harboring while depressed.  It seemed to increase my sex drive and actually the side effects felt like Viagra in that I had a flushed face and slightly fast heartbeat along with the mild headache.  I am hoping that my better moods continue and that I can get back to enjoying my life and being more optimistic about the future."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$3$I was on wellbutrin XL 300mg for 6 years. After 3 years I started having extreme woozy/lightheaded spells that were ruining my life. Everyone kept blaming it on my anxiety. After three years of hating life I went off of wellbutrin. It took over 30 days before I even started to see relief
column3: but by the 90 day mark I was free from those spells. I have my life back. It would not have gone away. Wellbutrin helps with the kind of depression where you have NO motivation and crave sugar. It will make you dehydrated
column4: constipated
column5: edgy
column6: and a light sleeper that only needs about 6 hours per night. It isn't good for anxiety and will not help it. During the adjustment period you could lose about 10 lbs and have the most vivid nightmares ever. This drug will stop working for you. At first you can be so numb but after awhile you start to feel very depressed again. It's not until you go off of it do you realize that it was helping. It really only seems to be popular because of the lack of weight gain and no decrease in your sex drive. Those are really the only positive things but you just have to figure out if the other side effects are worth it.

column4: which I did. Currently
column5: I haven't had any seizures to date. I just wanted to put a warning out there to users (especially with high dosages) not to disregard the warning about the seizures!! "

25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I took 300mg (150mg at 6am&3pm)for seven days. At first
column3: I had typical side effects and managed well - dry mouth
column4: metallic taste in my mouth
column5: trouble sleeping. I did experience the benefits of the medication almost immediately after starting to include increased energy. However
column6: on the seventh day after the second dose
column7: I had an allergic reaction about three hours later - due to
column8: according to the doctor
column9: the compounding effect of the medication. I began feeling itchy and had problems with my throat. I could breath and swallow
column10: but my throat felt constricted and like I had a lump in the back. It was very scary and caused me to panic. I called emergency and saw my doctor
column11: who discontinued the medication immediately. My throat is fine
column12: but I still feel a little itchy. That will pass as the medication gets out of my system.

column1: I share this because while allergies are rare
column2: they can happen and if they do
column3: call your doctor immediately. I know that everyone reacts to medications differently and am hopeful that my experience is unique and that others have a positive experience.

866$Depression$3/14/2013 8:32:20 PM$Reviewer: joyifuld, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$4$I've only been taking this medication for 2 weeks. Though I am experiencing some mild side effects (memory issues, weird taste in my mouth, some muscle pain in my neck and restlessness at night) overall I do feel it is helping. Due to menopause issues, I was dealing with severe depression and anxiety. The anxiety is completely gone, even in this short amount of time!  I still experience the depression, however it is less than it was. Also, the intense cravings for sweets is gone, though I have not lost weight as others have on Wellbutrin.  I'm assuming it (the lessening of the depression) will continue to improve as the weeks go by. I know it takes a while for the clinical dosage to really start working. Considering the good experience I'm already having, I will continue with Wellbutrin. My doctor is working closely with me to make sure all goes well. I don't always handle medications well so we will see how this goes. I have not experienced the increased sexual desire that others talk about and quite honestly, I am hoping and praying that I  never do!

1286$Depression$2/10/2009 5:55:19 PM$Reviewer: me27513, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$Why do docs use only one drug at a time? After 20 years of experimenting with SSRIs, I have an almost ideal combo of Wellbutrin XL (generic) 150 mg each morning PLUS Lexapro 10 mg each night. Wellbutrin made me hyper at first, so I lowered the dosage. It has no negative sexual side effects, so it balances Lexapro nicely (in fact, it has the opposite effect). No weight gain, late-night munchies, sleeping all the time. It's truly different from all the rest. Effexor was awful, Paxil made me fat, Zoloft made me sleepy, Prozac made me nuts, and none of those helped my depression. Wellbutrin saved me, and its generics are so much cheaper than the alternatives. If you're not doing well with the standard Rx, try this...it's truly different, and ask your doc about combining meds.  
1288$Depression$2/5/2009 2:57:05 AM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$i have been using the generic wellbutrin for just a little over a week now.  the first week i took one 150 tablet a day and now i have to increase it to 2 a day.  within a few days i started feeling a little more positive and i noticed that things i would normally get peeved about were not bothering me at all.  i can still feel a little bummed when i think about the things that bother me, but it gets less and less everyday.  The side effects i've had is dry mouth, sore throat, and a weird taste in the morning and late at night.  I have also had insomnia but i suffered from that long before and my doctor has prescribed me a sleeping pill that works hand in hand with wellbutrin.  I have noticed that i have been feeling a little more jittery today since i have increased it but i will moniter and see if my amount is too much.  I believe that this will go away after a while though.  lastly i just wanted to add that i ate my feeling when i was depressed and while i am not horribly overweight i am a little and that was one of my biggest reasons for being depressed.  and slowly i am noticing my appitite and cravings going down and i think i am losing a little weight.  thank god!  but i recommend doing your homework and not settling but finding the right drug for you. before i took lexapro and it killed my sex life and i took cymbalta and it made me very dizzy and nauscious.  so i have finally found something that works FOR ME.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$4$After dealing with depression for probably two years I finally worked up the nerve to talk to my Dr. about it.  I really didn't want to think I had something I couldn't take care of myself.  I started taking a low dosage of Wellbutrin (actually the generic) once a day about 2 months ago and it has worked very well for me.  The first couple of weeks I felt a little dazed and loopy and I have mild headaches every now and then but those seem to be the only side effects.  I actually lost a little weight when I started but now have come to a stand still in the weight area.  My overall mood has benefited greatly and I find myself enjoying life more and I take things in stride much better. My Dr. has suggested that I only stay on it for a few more months and then go off it which I think I will try as I hate being on a medication every day.  I do think I'll wait until Spring as I live in Upstate New York and our winters always depress me!  I found this sight because I'm looking for a cold medicine with a decongestant that I can take with Wellbutrin.  I don't like having to worry about drug interactions when I just want to take a simple cold tablet.  I would recommend this medicine to anybody that is looking for some releif from depression.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been taking Wellbutrin consistently for approximately 8 years now. It was the one and only anti-depressant I was even willing to try based on the possible side-effects. Thankfully
column3: it worked for me because I know many people have to try several different types of meds before they find the right one (or combination) that will work for them. I do recall that it took about six weeks for many of the initial side effects to go away; tingling sensation
column4: bad taste in mouth
column5: mild nausea
column6: insomnia
column7: etc. At the time
column8: I was severely depressed/suicidal and suffered from PTSD as well. The initial bothersome side effects were minor compared to my critical emotional state
column9: so I didn't focus on them too much. I'm glad for that now
column10: because I could've easily decided that the drug wasn't working and found myself getting on the medication roller coaster that many people suffer through. I wouldn't be here if I hadn't taken this drug. The other thing that helped is that I didn't rely on medication alone. At my worst
column11: I was seeing a counselor 2-3 times per week. Eventually
column12: I was able to go on a very light dose (100mg 1xday)
column13: just as a preventative measure. That was 6 years ago. No recurrence of depression and I couldn't identify any side effects that are problematic if I tried. Severe
column14: chronic depression runs in my familly and my first onset of this level of clinical depression was when I was just 9 years old
column15: (I'm 45 now). One of my brothers was even younger. The only family members that are not struggling with severe depression are the ones that are on Wellbutrin. One family member changed meds (from Well to many others) because he couldn't deal with the insomnia and he spent the next 4 years spiraling down to the pits of hell. He is now going to let me try 200mg per day in 2 doses 12 hours apart instead of just one big 200 mg dose all at one time.(I weigh less than 120 lbs so it was a bit much for me) Be patient
column2: if you are taking it for less than a month
column3: stay with it for a little longer
column4: the side effects went away for me.

1408$Depression$4/16/2008 10:24:31 PM$Reviewer: Achey, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year$1$1$1$***EXTREMELY IMPORTANT*** If you are using this drug in conjunction with Imipramine you should have your blood levels checked. Taking Wellbutrin together with Imipramine, the Wellbutrin has some kind of a reaction that does not allow the Liver to properly metabolize the Imipramine.  This happend to me.  I presented with all kinds of Neurological symptoms, but actually had VERY HIGH BLOOD LEVELS of imipramine even though my dosage had remained unchanged for over a year.  There is some actual medical research available to back this up, however, until recently this has not been a problem because these two drugs are not often prescribed together.

column1: 1453$Depression$12/9/2007 8:20:06 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$4$I have struggled with depression my whole life and I am not 34. I have been one-and-off meds since 2000. In April 2007 I went back on the meds again. This time it was Zoloft
column2: which made me feel terrific when it kicked in
column3: but I gradually needed more and more until I (at 110 lbs) was at the maximum dosage of 200mg generic Zoloft (sertraline) by September 2007. So my psychiatrist added Wellbutrin
column4: which seemed to help. Honestly
column5: as someone who actually works as a license adolescent therapist and has a lot of experience with my own and treating depression.... the cycle never ends. You spend your whole life switching meds
column6: gradually going off the meds
column7: changing meds
column8: and starting meds over. The best thing you can do is read a lot of books about depression and figure out what contributes to your depression. For me
column9: I grew up with an alcoholic parents and basically walked on egg shells. You never knew if you'd be yanked out of bed by your hair in the middle of the night to wash dishes
column10: you could never have a friend over and no matter what you did it was wrong. Research shows this actually interferes with your brain development and contributes to depression. Today
column11: I have a busy career and I have to monitor how much I take on or I get angry and obsessive along with the depression. I can also say you need to marry someone who understands depression and is NOT depressed themselves. The spouse needs to be supportive and you need to have rules. One of our rules is that my husband will never walk away from me (because it sends me into a depressive rage). My husband also realizes that sometimes I say mean and nasty things to him that I would never say if I weren't having a depressive angry moment. It's hard. We have a toddler and my husband is an at home dad. We love our daughter and want her to have a parents at home
column12: but it can't be me with my depression. My husband being at home help lessen my depression because it's less home-management for me. [email protected]

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have been taking 300mg of Bupropion XL (the generic form of Wellbutrin XL) for four years and I have to say this medicine has saved my life. Before I started Bupropion
column3: I had had five depressive episodes in four years; I have not had a depressive episode since I began taking Bupropion four years ago. I can feel happy again and I can laugh. I am able to feel sadness
column4: but it doesn't overwhelm me. I am not drowning in self-loathing anymore. I am myself again and I have been myself for four years. As far as negative side-effects are concerned
column5: I will have a migraine if I accidentally skipped a dose the day before. It also took a while to kick in. The first two weeks were difficult because my brain would go ""offline"" in the afternoon and I wouldn't be able to do anything until my brain ""restarted"" later in the evening. This pattern lasted for a few weeks. The first month was pretty terrible
column6: though there were glimmers that things were changing; I would feel less awful than usual for ten minutes every few days. The second month was a little better; I was able to feel happy for an entire hour one day and could generally enjoy things more. Week nine was when I had five whole good days where I could feel happy any time I wanted all day long. Week ten was when everything took off and I started feeling like myself again. Four years later
column7: this medication still works for me. I have been able to get back on my feet and rebuild my life after my depression because the chemicals in my brain are working for me and not against me. I feel good. I can feel good whenever I want. I'm not held captive by depression anymore. Bupropion made all of that possible."

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I am a 47 year old male diagnosed with ADHD combined with bouts of major depression. Over the years I have tried every tricyclic

Not to the same extent as the stimulants but it's enough that I can focus now and get tasks completed. I am so thankful for whoever invented bupropion. One think I noticed is that it is closely related to amphetamine and diethylpropion
column5: both used in the past as anti-depressants/anorectics. I believe it is this similarity that gives Wellbutrin the edge over the SSRI's (which are garbage in my opinion)currently in use and I would not hesitate to recommend Wellbutrin

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$5$"As an antidepressant

column1:
1690$Depression$1/16/2014 12:08:01 PM$Reviewer: Katherine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I initially started Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day (150 mg twice per day) in 2005 along with Celexa at 20 mg due to depression and anxiety. I eventually stopped taking Wellbutrin when my Celexa dose was increased to 60 mg which appeared to be the right dose/medication for me. I was recently reduced to 40 mg of Celexa due to new studies that no more than 40 mg should be taken due to risk of heart issues/death. I am now back on Wellbutrin at 300 mg/day due to the decreased dosage of Celexa. Wellbutrin has worked for me. Side effects included decreased appetite, a little weight loss initially and dry mouth. I am a smoker and I thought Wellbutrin might help with that too, however, I did not notice any decrease in cigarette cravings while on Wellbutrin. The only thing I STRONGLY caution is do not EVER take more than your prescribed amount of Wellbutrin. I overdosed by accident (took 600 mg in one day) about 2 years after I started taking it, it was the worst experience of my life. Hallucinations, paranoia, insomnia....I literally thought I was dead and everyone around me was a ghost. I ended up going to the ER because of it (I actually thought my dead body was at the hospital and I wanted to go there to wake myself up). NEVER, EVER overdose on this medication. You will be sorry! But again, taken as prescribed, I am pleased with it. 
1692$Depression$1/11/2014 10:49:51 AM$Reviewer: RxLisa, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$I have been taking Wellbutrin XL 300 mg for about 5 weeks now (started on 150 mg).  This has been much more effective than any other antidepressant I've taken.  In the past 20 years I've been on Prozac, Celexa, Zoloft (with and without Abilify) and also Deplin.  The first couple of weeks, I was a bit more irritable, but was ok with it, because I cared about things again and was engaging again in life.  I was mostly irritated at how I had let everything go because I just didn't care or have the energy to do anything.  In the last couple of weeks, I have developed neck pain, headaches, and intermittently blurry vision, which all are listed possible side effects.  It's working so well for my depression at this point that I'm willing to wait a couple of months to see if the side effects go away.  I'm not sure if I've lost weight, but I'm cooking more often and eating less.  With all the other meds I've tried, it was the other way around.  All medications have side effects, these, for me are tolerable to be able to enjoy my young children and actually enjoy life again.  Before Wellbutrin, I was just kind of dragging myself through life.  I've had depression pretty much my entire adult life and tried it with and without antidepressants.  So far, With Wellbutrin XL, I feel like myself again for the first time in a very long time.

I still wake regularly agitated and upset/angry over something that is nothing later on when I'm rested and awake--so agitated I could be awake all night. I wouldn't do it again; I'd take care of health by going to a spa and getting verbal/understanding/relational therapy. Finding a decent counsellor is difficult
column14: but persist. A mentor
column15: a priest
column16: a mature relative--these people can give a 'reality picture' or feedback so you can get grounded over time. It's not just understanding yourself; it's finding a real relationship that can go deeper than becoming a good social character. Someone to confide your soul with...don't stop looking but use your discrimination and don't just confide in anyone. Really know and watch the actions of this person for character and their own self-understanding. If you are really looking sincerely
column17: someone will appear and not necessarily cost you $100. an hour. For me

55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$This drug is doing a great job for me. I have been on it for 12 years. I originally took 150mg once a day; moved up to twice a day but switched to 300mg slow release so I wouldn't forget to take one of the doses. I tried so many different drugs over the past 20 years that I've lost count and the side affects were often horrific. Once my psychologist recommended Wellbutrin and my psychiatrist concurred I have never switched and it is the only anti-depressant I take. I also dropped 20 lbs of the 30 the other drugs had caused me to gain. It has helped with ADD
column3: SAD and the all encompassing symptoms of depression. There have been a few times during the years when I was unable to take it for several days in a row and you could tell but just one dose and I was back up feeling great. I'm sorry it doesn't work for everyone; it has so few uncomfortable side affects when compared to some of the newer drugs. But for those who have found relief I can tell you that after all these years I still have found relief. (My husband calls them my happy pills!)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Started these about 2 years ago after being  desperate because none of those that act on serotonin had worked for me. Best thing I ever did! I researched it on-line and found the ratio of people praising it to hating it was much more favourable than most other anti-depressants. Problem: I'm in the UK and it is only licensed for giving up smoking. So I have to order it from Europe or USA. I started by taking just a quarter of one 150mg tab and working up to the full dose by day 7. (different for everyone of course)

column1: Doing it this way made it much easier on the side-effects which for me were itchy rash on my hand and foot and difficulty getting to sleep maybe a bit of nausea but I found if I  ate some food with them it helped -even though my research said it shouldn't affect. I have read that taking a quarter of a tablet and building up gradually to lessen side-effects doesn't work. It really does for me. Bupropion has made me feel completely ""normal"" I didn't feel like I was on medication at all
column2: until recently. After about a year and half I found I got occasional head pains. Not a headache as such. If I lay down on my front suddenly to watch television or something like that i would get a sharp pressure-like pain. I would keep still or slowly sit up and it would pass. after a few months I gradually started to get a slight hang-over feeling for a few hours most days. without any changes to my diet etc. I don't normally get headaches. My delivery was very delayed recently and I literally ran out. I was very worried what would happen with suddenly stopping (i could not get any from the doctor of course) Nothing happened so I stayed off them for two months. I can now very slightly feel anxiety on waking up that I used to get but only slightly so I decided to start again rather than wait until it gets bad. Today is the first day and I have a bit of that slight tightness in the head feeling. Anyone else had similar?"

2093$Depression$3/2/2011 3:43:33 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$"I just started taking this drug today
column2: and after reading the reviews I am concerned about the generic version I was given (Bupropion XL
column3: I think). According to one article
column4: it's the patented membrane that allows for extended release that seems to be the problem. Apparently some generics don't use the same XR method
column5: which can lead to a huge release of the active ingredient followed by little to no release. Wellbutrin has a membrane-like wall that allows a constant release
column6: but many generics use pills that just dissolve slowly. Other bodily functions can speed up or slow down the release (i.e.
column7: amount of food in stomach). Just thought this was interesting so I'm passing it along and will also ask my doctor about it.  http://www.prevention.com/health/health/healthy-l iving/find-out-how-to-use-generic-drugs-safely/ar ticle/ca929d93636d6110VgnVCM10000013281eac____

2130$Depression$12/21/2010 2:40:38 PM$Reviewer: Mellow, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have taken this med on and off for several years and can tell you that every person is very different and all of the other antidepressants we tried before this one gave me very sad thoughts. It does come with its side effects just like the rest and you will have to determine is it worth it in the end for you.  In my case the benefits out weigh the effects.  I have dry mouth and headaches and some tension at times, but most of the time I am mellow.  This is very important to me as I hate high strung people even my self when I can't control my racing thoughts and brain fog.  It is a great drug in my opinion.

2160$Depression$10/21/2010 8:29:38 PM$Reviewer: medwisegirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin has been great for me. All I wanted to do before taking this was sleep, and when I was up I was grouchy and irritated. I actually like getting up in the morning and enjoy my day. Everyone around me is much happier as well. I tried Cymbalta first and it didn't fit my specific needs, and in fact worsened my depression. There are different medicines for different types of depression. Wellbutrin works on the neurotransmitter dopamine. Dopamine is for motivation and acivating the reward center in the brain. I wouldn't discourage or encourage the use of this drug. It's your doctors job, depending on your depression symptoms, to match you with the best medicine for you. You need not listen to people that say not to try it, everyone is different. This medicine may or may not work for you. Treating depression is not an exact science, due to our lack of knowledge about the brain. Finding the right depression medicine will take trial and error, which can be very frustrating. Stick with it and you will find a medicine that works for you.

2241$Depression$6/15/2010 11:54:53 AM$Reviewer: abirata, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin had side effects at the beginning - the worst of which were insomnia and constipation. The insomnia abated after about 3 weeks of treatment and I take a fiber supplement to deal with the constipation. It also abates with time but never completely goes away. Another side effect at firt was a general ""hyper"" feeling but that also wore off after a few weeks. Unlike the SSRIs
column2: Wellbutrin does not make me feel ""drugged” - I feel emotions
column3: good and bad - but the difference I notice while taking the drug is that I tend not to brood or obsess over negative events or ideas
column4: it is easier to let them pass. I think it has also made me more able to open up to talking about my situation because I don’t think I have to reign in my “bad” emotions so tightly as I don’t fear them getting out of control. It is easier to work through them
column5: and talk about them. Wellbutrin by itself is a great help
column6: but by far the most effective treatment for me has been talk therapy. Depression runs in the family. I did not start seeking treatment until age 27 when it became overwhelming  and was affecting my work and relationships. The first course of treatment my physician prescribed were SSRIs (Paxil
column7: Prozac and Zoloft)
column8: but I could not tolerate the side effects nausea and drowsiness
column9: but the worst
column10: that although my depression was dampened
column11: so were all my emotions. These side effects never abated. I became even more distant from people I loved and could not function effectively at work because it was difficult to concentrate. I had great doubts about all of the anti-depressants after those experiences
column12: and am skeptical of drug claims and the pharmaceutical industry in general but have to admit that Wellbutrin has been very effective. I know that SSRIs are very effective for many  people - I just wanted to share that portion of my experience because I believed that because they did not work for me
column13: nothing would. I am glad to be proven wrong."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$Wellbutrin was a life saver for me. I was diagnosed with Major Depression 5 years ago and initially was prescribed Celexa. I felt a little better but still had no concentration or energy. My psychiatrist added Wellbutrin XL and it turned out to be the answer I needed. I would not have survived my depression without the addition of Wellbutrin to my celexa (300mg Wellbutrin and 40 mg Celexa). I know some people have shared negative side effects of this drug but you will not know unless you try it. It worked well for me but it is not for everyone. If you have depression please do not give up on finding the right medication for you. It just takes some time. I have been on meds and in individual therapy and it has been successful  in treating my depression. I am now to the point where I am titrating my Wellbutrin so that I can be med free and start a family. Thank you Wellbutrin for giving me my life back!

2408$Depression$10/16/2009 4:05:59 PM$Reviewer: BJ,CALIFORNIA, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$4$I suffer from irritability, lack of motivation, depression, and anxiety. I have been medicatited most of the last 10 years. I was perscribed Welbutrin, and Celexa to take place of prozac, which hasn't really been effective for 2 years.I also started taking Clonopin 6 months ago, .5mg 1 or 2 a day. The Clp I like it seems to really help calm me. I take it around 1 pm before my kids come home from school! My primary care dr. retired so my new dr wasn't comfortable refilling the clonopin because it can be addictive! Who cares if I'm taking it everyday anyway? So I go see a real phsyc. dr. f9or help. The first 2 days I was very tense and jumpy had hot flashes. After that the migrain hit. I have suffered from headaches in the past so didn't relate it to the meds for a couple days. But after 4 days of severe pain in the top of my head, I spoke to my Dr. who said a small percent of people will experience migrain from the Wb. The next morning I had an ice pack on my neck at six am. I took only the Celexa that day and realized around 11am my headache was almost gone! I still had tension and restlessness dry mouth. Today I didn't take anything until about 11 am I took 1/2 clonopin to take the edge off. I am actually feeling good today. I slept better last night. That helped alot! I see him in one week, during that time I will try go solo as much as possible. (I have my clonopin if I get too out of hand!) Then I will ask my dr to try effexor xl. I was on this for 5 years before I got pregnant with my youngest. I did very well after the 1st couple weeks of side effects. Hope this helps someone. I know I go to the reviews to see how pills effect different people. It helps. We all have a different chemistry and a single goal in common...TO FEEL GOOD!

column1: 2420$Depression$10/2/2009 9:33:06 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I had suffered from depression for years before I started taking Wellbutrin.  It has made a major positive difference in my life in the way I handle things; I am able to think much more clearly and rationally.  For the first few years I combined the medication with therapy.  I was taking 225 mg when I started and have had to increase it once to 300 mg/ day.  I currently take the Wellbutrin 300 XL.  Word of caution on the generic version of Wellbutrin 300 XL - I tried it when it was approved and found after a few months that I was becoming depressed again.  The generic did not work for me; the tablet may have the same amount of medication but the packing (what makes up the rest of the pill)is completely different than the brand name.  For me it seemed like instead of medication being steadily administered to my system throughout the day it hit all at once
column2: thus the return of the depression.  I was hoping to be able to save some money with the generic but it is worth it to me to take the brand name.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have suffered from depression most of my life.  In my early 20’s I started see a psychiatrist.  I received talk therapy as well as antidepressants’ throughout my life.  I have been off & on Prozac for the past 20 years.  For nearly two years

I started to feel like I was going back to my old pattern of sleeping too much (not as bad as before but still too much) and not as much energy as with Wellbutrin.. 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"I am taking Wellbutrin SR. This stuff is so good they should put it in the water supply! I have energy
column3: my spastic boss does not get me annoyed anymore. I am calm
column4: I can deal with life's little problems much easier now. Have only been taking it for about a month. A little dry mouth is well worth it!! I have lost 16 pounds since I started taking it. No desire to drink any alcohol even a glass of wine tastes terrible now.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on wellbutrin for 15 years-I came off of it for a short time but the anxiety caused me to return to it again. Like most depression sufferers I have tried many drugs over the years but this one has the least side effects and works great. I occasionally get dry mouth so you do need to stay hydrated.  I was a smoker and a drinker and have kicked both habits as the drug really does reduce cravings for any pleasure. Unfortunately that does include sex as well-it does decrease your libido but that can be overcome if you work at it! It does not decrease the pleasure level but the desire to get started just isn't there. I did have a period of time where I was not eating as it does also take away your cravings for food. My hubby loves to eat so he makes me eat too
column3: so I have not had anorexia since I met him but I did with my first husband. So I would say that an understanding mate goes a long way toward helping to make this drug a success. I take 150 sr upon waking and before bed. My insurer is also pushing the generic but that did not work for me. I understand there are some generics that are better than others and if the cost is a factor you could try those first. I am convinced that wellbutin treats alcoholism because it runs in my family and I was a problem drinker until I took wellbutrin. I can have a drink now and not want another-but that may just be me. It is sure worth a try if you drink too much-I don't know why it is not more widely used for treating alcoholism because it works. You do have to take wellbutrin for 60 to 90 days to get the full effect of the drug.During that time you do have dry mouth but that subsides after a while and was not a significant problem for me. I am 62 years old so I don't know how much longer I will take it but the doctors seem to think that it is a lifelong drug. It has made a drastic change in my life and I recomend it highly!!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I have had depression for many years and my doc put me on this drug quite a number of years ago. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$5$Was prescribed the generic Bupropion HCL for mild depression and anxiety.  The first few days on 150 mg were a little scary.  I had a headache the entire time.  This only lasted about 3 days.  On the fifth day started 300 mg.  Loved the energy boost and eveniness of my mood. I also immediately quit smoking...have tried quitting many times before with no success. I started getting bad cramps and realized I was horribly constipated.  Tried upping my fiber and fluid intakes but nothing helped.  I had to stop taking it because of this...BUMMER.  I really liked this med and wish I could continue but I can't take laxative everyday to conteract the constipation!!!!!!!  Some decrease in sexual desire did occur.  My doc prescribed me Effexor XR and I filled the ordered but I do not think I will try this one because of the horrible things I have been reading about it.  I will be asking her about Cymbalta because the reviews seem much more positive.  I wish the makers of Wellbutrin/Bupripion could fix the constipation issue because it worked great for me!

2640$Depression$2/24/2009 8:24:38 PM$Reviewer: ABMN, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$In Dec 2007 I was prescribed Wellbutrin 150mg, after the initial few weeks it just didn't seem to be working. My doctor bumped me up the the XL. It started working almost immediately. It felt as if the veil and earmuffs had been removed and colors and sounds became real again. I was extremely happy with the 50 lbs I lost. Sex drive came back with a vengeance. No listed side effects. It is now Feb 2009 and it doesn't seem to be working anymore; back to being irritable, short tempered and just sad. Going to Dr in 2 days to see if something else will work. One side effect that I can't find anyone else having is it messed with my period, even on birth control. My period would come whenever it wanted regardless of what week of pills I was on. Once I switched to taking the BCP at night and Wellbutrin XL in the a.m. it seemed to get MUCH better. Now that the wellbutrin isn't working as great, my cycle is completely whacked. Usually one week w/o it, then get it for a few days, then another week w/o, etc. Doctors say it has nothing to do with each other but I have been on the same BCP for almost 6 years and it didn't happen until I started taking the Wellbutrin XL.

column1: I've been on Wellbutrin for (about) a year and MUST comment on the effects of the generic brand
column2: Bupropion (Sp?).
I spent a while on the generic version and failed to progress out of my depressive state. For a few weeks I felt like I was mildly feeling a change
column3: but eventually it felt like I had plateaued
column4: and shortly after
column5: I returned to spiraling downward.

column1: There were other medications added and subtracted to Wellbutrin in order to determine the right combination of drugs to aid my depression/anxiety/ADD. I AM POSITIVE that my only improvement was the result of other medications (Lamictal- mood stabilizer).
It has been documented that the generic version of this drug does NOT produce the same progressive results as the name brand. I can confidently say

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"Bupropion has literally saved my life.  I didn't want to live before I started taking it.  I have been taking it for 17  years now.  The few side effects it has go away after about six weeks of taking it.  At first I was a bit shaky

column7: 000 per year to spend you better use generic. (I'm not exaggerating this price)  Another tip:   I have found with the generic it's best to use the 100 mg three times per day vs. the 300 mg XL one time per day.  The generic XL (extended release) does not work for me.  It took me literally years to figure this out so...you're welcome.  :)   "

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$3$4$I am a seven  year user of Bupropion. Over the years I have changed dosages from 300 to 350
column3: from 450 to 400
column4: back down to 300
column5: recently back to 450. There is a persistent sadness tightly woven through the fabric of my emotions and feelings. I function fairly well most of the time. Sometimes I feel stuck. I don't want to do anything except space out. I get stuck in my own head like I'm withdrawn into my own bubble. None the less. the Bupropion has enabled me to get up off my ass and most forward with life. Whenever I feel super stuck
column6: I check in with my therapist and doctor. Sometimes we tweak the dosage. I also think some generic brands are poor quality. If you can get Wellbutrin
column7: do it. The generic stuff can be wonky sometimes and I'm not trying to play Russian Roulette with my life. Coupled with therapy and a sharp progressive doctor
column8: I can manage.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$3$5$Be aware that the generic versions of this drug are not always effective.  And if you have a male doctor MAKE SURE that they listen and understand if you have ANY problems!

55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I've been on this medication for 4 years. I'm 61. I've been diagnosed with depression bordering on major depression. I've gone thru 4 knee surgeries and now I've had a pacemaker installed. All this happened within the last 18 months. I went from a wheelchair to walking with my cane during that time. I feel my body is breaking down. My exercise routine has been hindered. I can't do the things I could've done before. I have to accept that I'm getting old! All of these factors contributed to taking Bupropion. I have to tell my mental health provider on the next session; that I've increased my dosage. This stems from the latest problems that have transpired. I increased the dosage from 300mg to 400mg. I feel so much better. I see her every 120 days. She knows everything about me. Initially asking many questions ranging from my social life to my sex life. That's to determine what dosage I needed. The only problem; I can't get an erection. Bupropion has the least sexual side effect on that problem. I'll have to live with it. But it really upsets me. I feel that my male ego has been devastated. But life goes on. We review how things are going. She keeps my medical file up to date. We come to an agreement what dosage I need after discussing what's been going on in my life. She's really a great nurse practitioner. Someone to talk and listen to. I enjoy going to see her. I look forward to all of my future sessions with her.

55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I am very satisfied with Bupropion HCL. I was on it 3 years ago. But stopped. Now
column3: my nurse practitioner asked many questions stemming from my sexual activity
column4: diet
column5: contact with friends and family
column6: church and other things. She compiled a history about me. She's a fantastic person. She decided my starting dosage would be two 100mg tablets; one when I wake up and the other at noon. We will discuss the dosage after two months. At that time she might increase my dosage. For me it is an appetite suppressant. I have some sexual side effects; I take Trazedone to maintain my erection. And it helps me go to sleep. You really need to work together to overcome depression. Overall Bupropion HCL works for me.

The downside is that every day so far, 2 hours after taking it, I puke a few times and am nauseous almost all morning. 728$Major Depressive Disorder$2/6/2019 4:59:28 PM$Reviewer: Mike, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I had struggled with depression on my own before finally giving in and seeing a therapist. I resisted therapy and drugs for years- men are supposed to take care of their own problems....aren't they? Well a series of very trying and anxiety ridden events pushed me over the edge and on my way to getting help- I'm glad I reached out. After going over the options my doctor prescribed Wellbutrin extended release in a 150mg once daily dose (in the morning- don't take it in the evening or you will struggle to fall sleep). I have to say that this drug has really helped me. The very low, sad moods are gone, the fits of anger have subsided, I have more patience at work and with family, I haven't had a drink in months and I no longer think about suicide. I have a much easier time controlling my appetite, which with giving up alcohol, has resulted in a loss of about 20 lbs. My wife has remarked many times that I am 'nicer' now that I am on medication. I have to take her word for it. Seems I was stuck in a dark pit of my own making and couldn't figure a way to get out. I was going through the motions and was thoroughly miserable while doing it, and making everyone around me uneasy. This drug isn't a cure all for bad attitudes and badly lived lives but it can help, possibly, if a person is motivated to change. It will wind you up a bit- I do take a mild sedative at night to sleep. I have also found Wellbutrin to reduce libido but only slightly - this seems to run counter to many others experience. I have addressed that little problem by taking very small doses (7mg- 1/4 of a 25mg pill) of Viagra when the time is right. Otherwise there seem to be few negative side effects, at least for me. I don't like to take drugs but I recognize that Wellbutrin is very useful. Its off patent and I ask for the generic (Bupropion- inexpensive). At some point I hope to taper down and get off it but I could stay on it for a long time if I needed to and could live my life fully.                
746$Major Depressive Disorder$8/4/2017 5:36:19 AM$Reviewer: Kimbork, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Welbutrin is the only treatment that has worked for me for depression and anxiety. 1725$Major Depressive Disorder$10/20/2013 8:41:25 PM$Reviewer: Bobby's Girl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $1$1$1$My daughter suffered a rare severe systemic allergic reaction (DRESS syndrome) after two weeks of being on this drug.  The reaction is often misdiagnosed as a virus, as was in my daughter's case.  After two clinic visits and two trips to the ER, she finally was diagnosed correctly, but had to be hospitalized for a week.   She gained 30 lbs. of fluid in just a few days and was covered with a beet-red rash.  Her major organs were also affected.  She had to be treated with steroids, which is another side-effect story.  Be your own advocate-  if you develop a rash while taking any prescription drug, take it seriously!   Your life depends on it.  DRESS Syndrome is a living nightmare and too many doctors do not have the expertise to recognize it.

1895$Major Depressive Disorder$6/20/2012 12:58:22 AM$Reviewer: intricate_eyes, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $2$1$4$I took 150mg of the generic bupropion HCL XL, once per day in the morning. First thing I noticed on the second day of taking it was that I was unusually short of breath, and my heart started being quickly randomly throughout the day. On the fifth day I woke up with a sore left arm, and the pain spread to the left side of my chest. Developed chest pressure and that continued on for the full 8 days that I took the medication and ended when I went off the medicine. My anxiety also seemed to have increased; I could never calm down and my body always felt heavy. However, the only somewhat positive thing I can mention is that I felt that this medicine kind of woke me up a bit; before I was pretty numb, but I started feeling again. The side effects were enough to make me go off of it within 8 days. I hope to try the name brand Wellbutrin to see if there is an improvement. 
1899$Major Depressive Disorder$6/14/2012 1:37:03 AM$Reviewer: girlgotfangs, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$First drug to work for me. Wellbutrin gave me energy, I lost a good amount of weight, wasn't sleeping as much. No negative side effects annoying enough to even mention. What I enjoyed the most was not being in the pit. All Ive felt all my life is despair. No drug can make someone happy but this one lifted me up out of the horrible pit and gave me a chance at life.

1968$Major Depressive Disorder$1/2/2012 1:30:14 AM$Reviewer: hopeful65, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has been a life saving treatment for me.  I have been on multiple drugs for my depression over the last several years and in and out of the hospital several times also.  I was put on the Welbutrin after my last hospitalization for attempting to take my own life earlier this year(2011).  I am currently on the maximum dose and I also take Lamictal(100mg)and Remeron(30 mg) to help with sleep.  I was like a zombie with the 5 meds I was on before my suicide attempt now I feel so much better.  For the first time in 6 yrs I have my energy back, I'm not falling asleep during the day,I am hopeful instead of hopeless and I am back working after an extended medicalleave.  I do see a therapist in addition to the medication currently and attribute the success of my recovery to the combination of the new medicine, therapy and the intensive care I received in my week and a half stay at a psychiatric hospital 6 months ago but I believe the medication change to Welbutrin has made a huge difference.  I hope my experience is helpful to someone out there who is suffering from this medical illness that can be difficult to treat.

My pain level went from 7/10 to 12/10 which made me more irritable & into the circle we go.  By the end of 3rd week I slept 20 minutes @ time.  My thought process is clearer then on Zoloft but can't interact around people so I am on to the next one.
1994$Major Depressive Disorder$10/11/2011 5:56:44 PM$Reviewer: bamagirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$It has helped my major depression tremendously.I call it my ""MIRACLE DRUG""..."

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$3$5$It helped my depression somewhat.  I was nagged by an underlying feeling of anxiety and nauseous stomach.  It definitely improved my sex life.  I had been on Cymbalta and it worked well except in the bedroom.  I give Wellbutrin an OK.  I really need something more effective for depression.  I may take the leap to a new drug called Viibryd which is hyped as offering good depression relief without the sex problems.  I first got on Wellbutrin to knock out the Cymbalta sex effects.  It didn't work.  I may find myself on it to aid the Viibryd if it turns out to be problematic.  Anyway
column3: good luck with Wellbutrin.  If it works for you..that's great.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I have taken 17-18 different psyc meds before I was given WB.  1 or some of those meds gave me Tardive Dyskinesa.

column1: I have been taking WB for 20+years.  I was taking 450mg a day.  It seems like it's not working as effectively as it did in the early days.  Now my DR has upped my dosage to 600 MG a day. That doesn't seem to be working either.  I'm trying to find a new DR but hate the prospects of being hospitalized for the 5th time."

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$4$"Have been on this med for about 5 years on and off for depression and lack on sexual desire due to Lexapro. First time I took this about 5 years ago I was literally having sexual urges constantly so my doctor took me off it after a month of ""bliss but agony"". Well
column3: speaking to my psychiatrist who specializes in meds and heads the state board where I live
column4: Wellbutrin was actually considered being used as a drug for lacking sexual desire when they did their initial studies. This was due to the results of the initial tests showing increased sexual desire of women and actual orgasm without stimulation. It was being studied at this time to see positive effects for depression. It helped me the first time I took it although I felt like a nympho. Back on it again 3 years ago to help libido but doing nothing but causing constipation...no sexual desire at all. Actually wish I was experiencing my initial use ""urges"" that caused me to stop it
column5: was having ""almost orgasms"" at work and couldn't concentrate."

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$3$5$"Having issues with constipation - although constipation is listed about 5th or 6th as possible side effects - with me it's #1 - it's terrible. I told my Doc. and she prescribed this because she had prescribed Wellbutrin ER
column3: 200MG taken 2x per day. With the new prescription she also prescribed Doc-Q-Lace. I started the new therapy on a Thursday - Today is Tuesday - no bowel movement yet. Along with the new drug therapy I have included all old stand bys for constipation - prune juice -  prunes - large quantities of fruit and vegatables - copious amounts of water and have stayed mobile to help move things along - no dice.

column1: Trying to find someone else that had this same side effect. My doctor seems to think I am one of 1000 that has had this happen."
